pros: Lots of leadership to provide guidance
cons: The place is well run. However salary should be higher however it is a nonprofit

review_title: Rewarding Work in a Good Atmosphere
pros:
The company really cares about its patients and treats them well. I work with at most two patients a day, so I can take my time to educate about the eyes and retinal diseases. Patients hardly ever give you a hard time since their services at our non-profit facility are covered for them, and their participation is voluntary. 

Concerning benefits, all major holidays are paid time off, plus a few more. Allowed vacations and sick days are generous, even for new hires after 90 days. PTO increases with tenure up to 6 weeks after 15 years. Medical insurance for the minimum plan is completely covered.

review_title: Great environment and work life balance
job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Richardson, TX
pros: Caring and friendly people. Decent pay.
cons: Office space is minimal and without many windows. Disorganized.

pros: This nonprofit organization's mission is to save sight, and that's exactly what they do. With world renowned scientists leading basic and clinical research into the causes, treatments, and consequences of vision disorders that cause low vision and blindness, I can't think of a better place to be to contribute to science.
cons: Unable to meet in person for Foundation-wide meetings right now because of COVID, but still have zoom meetings.

pros: This is a good company to work for. We have under 50 employees so it is a friendly place to work where everyone knows everyone. The work we do is very important and makes a difference in peoples lives.
cons: Being a smaller company most of us wear several hats.

job_title: Assistant Development Manager in Dallas, TX
pros:
-Many of the Retina Foundation's Lab Directors, Research Associates, and Admin staff have been with the organization for more than 10 years. Dr. David Birch and Dr. Eileen Birch have dedicated their lives to the Retina Foundation. 
-Board members are engaged. They are helping with the Retina Foundation's Strategic Plan, attending our events, donating, etc.
cons: -The Retina Foundation is a little far away from the popular Uptown/Downtown neighborhoods. It is very close to central Dallas though and just about 1 mile away from North Park.

job_title: Clinical Research Assistant I in Dallas, TX
pros: Great patients and subjects. Some interesting studies happen under the PIs that actually care. The other PIs not so much.
cons: A few of the PIs were great while I was working there. However, the majority didn't seem to care for their work and only did the minimum to get by.

pros: I loved working here. Great place to do meaningful work that definitely makes a difference in the lives of those with visual disorders.
cons: Since it is a non profit, salary may be lower than comparable positions in industry

pros: Being able to work with the people marginalised in society
cons: People failing to understand that what am doing is my passion

pros: Save some money for further study
cons: May have worse impact on study
